Smoking pack-years (unified approach)

Source: R/smoking.R
pack_years_fun.Rd

This function creates a derived variable (pack_years_der) that measures an individual's smoking pack-years based on various CCHS smoking variables. This is a popular variable used by researchers to quantify lifetime exposure to cigarette use.

pack_years_fun(
  SMKDSTY_A,
  DHHGAGE_cont,
  time_quit_smoking,
  SMKG203_cont,
  SMKG207_cont,
  SMK_204,
  SMK_05B,
  SMK_208,
  SMK_05C,
  SMKG01C_cont,
  SMK_01A,
  validate_params = FALSE,
  min_DHHGAGE_cont = 12,
  max_DHHGAGE_cont = 102,
  min_time_quit_smoking = 0.5,
  max_time_quit_smoking = 82,
  min_SMKG203_cont = 8,
  max_SMKG203_cont = 84,
  min_SMKG207_cont = 8,
  max_SMKG207_cont = 84,
  min_SMK_204 = 1,
  max_SMK_204 = 99,
  min_SMK_05B = 1,
  max_SMK_05B = 99,
  min_SMK_208 = 1,
  max_SMK_208 = 99,
  min_SMK_05C = 0,
  max_SMK_05C = 31,
  min_SMKG01C_cont = 8,
  max_SMKG01C_cont = 84
)

Arguments

SMKDSTY_A

variable used in CCHS cycles 2001-2014 that classifies smoking status

DHHGAGE_cont

continuous age variable

time_quit_smoking

derived variable for time since quitting smoking

SMKG203_cont

age started smoking daily (daily smokers)

SMKG207_cont

age started smoking daily (former daily smokers)

SMK_204

number of cigarettes smoked per day (daily smokers)

SMK_05B

number of cigarettes smoked per day (occasional smokers)

SMK_208

number of cigarettes smoked per day (former daily smokers)

SMK_05C

number of days smoked at least one cigarette

SMKG01C_cont

age smoked first cigarette

SMK_01A

smoked 100 cigarettes in lifetime (y/n)

validate_params

logical, enable parameter validation (default FALSE)

min_DHHGAGE_cont

minimum valid age (default 12)

max_DHHGAGE_cont

maximum valid age (default 102)

min_time_quit_smoking

minimum valid time since quitting (default 0.5)

max_time_quit_smoking

maximum valid time since quitting (default 82)

min_SMKG203_cont

minimum valid age started daily (default 5)

max_SMKG203_cont

maximum valid age started daily (default 84)

min_SMKG207_cont

minimum valid age started daily former (default 5)

max_SMKG207_cont

maximum valid age started daily former (default 80)

min_SMK_204

minimum cigarettes per day daily (default 1)

max_SMK_204

maximum cigarettes per day daily (default 99)

min_SMK_05B

minimum cigarettes per day occasional (default 1)

max_SMK_05B

maximum cigarettes per day occasional (default 99)

min_SMK_208

minimum cigarettes per day former (default 1)

max_SMK_208

maximum cigarettes per day former (default 99)

min_SMK_05C

minimum days smoked (default 0)

max_SMK_05C

maximum days smoked (default 31)

min_SMKG01C_cont

minimum age first cigarette (default 8)

max_SMKG01C_cont

maximum age first cigarette (default 84)

Value

value for smoking pack-years in the pack_years_der variable

Note

v3.0.0, last updated: 2025-06-30, status: active, Note: Enhanced calculation logic with better edge case handling

References

Holford, T.R., et al. (2014). Patterns of Birth Cohort–Specific Smoking Histories, 1965–2009. Am J Prev Med, 46(2), e31-7. doi:10.1016/j.amepre.2013.10.022

Manuel, D.G., et al. (2020). Smoking Patterns Based on Birth-Cohort-Specific Histories from 1965 to 2013, with Projections to 2041. Health Reports, 31(11), 16-31. https://www150.statcan.gc.ca/n1/pub/82-003-x/2020011/article/00002-eng.htm

Examples

# Standard CCHS processing (no validation)
pack_years_fun(1, 45, NA, 18, NA, 20, NA, NA, NA, NA, 1)
#> [1] 27

# RDC with validation for data quality
pack_years_fun(1, 45, NA, 18, NA, 20, NA, NA, NA, NA, 1,
               validate_params = TRUE, min_DHHGAGE_cont = 12, max_DHHGAGE_cont = 102)
#> [1] 27
